lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Anya.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Anya.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Constructs a new instance of the {@code Anya} class with the specified storage file path.
* This constructor initializes the user interface (UI), storage, and task list parser for the Anya application.
* It also loads tasks from the specified storage file and handles exceptions related to storage operations.
* @param storageFilePath The file path where the task data is stored.
* @throws RuntimeException If there is an issue with the storage file path or storage operation,
*                          a runtime exception is thrown, and an initialization error message is
* Executes the main functionality of the Anya application by running its core components.
* This method is responsible for executing the main workflow of the Anya application, which includes displaying a
* greeting message, parsing user input, and showing an exit message when the application is finished.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs during the execution of this method, it may throw an IOException.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Enum representing the available commands in the Anya application.
* This enum defines the various command types that can be used by the user to interact with the Anya application.
* Each enum value corresponds to a specific user command, such as "BYE" for exiting the application or "TODO" for
BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, FIND, UNKNOWN
* Custom exception class for handling Anya-specific exceptions.
* This class extends the standard Java Exception class to create custom exceptions tailored for the Anya application.
* It allows for the propagation of Anya-specific error messages when exceptional conditions occur during execution.
* Constructs a new instance of the {@code AnyaException} class with the specified error message.
* @param message A descriptive error message explaining the exceptional condition.
* Custom exception class for handling invalid arguments in Anya commands.
* This class extends the {@code AnyaException} class to create custom exceptions specifically for cases where
* invalid arguments are provided to Anya commands. It allows for the propagation of error messages indicating
* that an invalid argument was detected.
* Constructs a new instance of the {@code InvalidArgumentException} class with the specified error message.
* @param message A descriptive error message explaining the invalid argument condition.
public static final String MESSAGE_GREETING = "Hello! I'm Anya Forger.\n"
public static final String MESSAGE_ERROR_LOADING = "Error loading file.";
public static final String MESSAGE_ERROR_INIT = "Error initializing Bot.";
public static final String MESSAGE_EXIT = "Bye! Hope to see you again.";
* The `Parser` class is responsible for interpreting user input
* and executing corresponding actions in the Anya application.
* It handles parsing commands, validating arguments,
* and performing the appropriate operations on tasks and data storage.
* Constructs a new `Parser` instance with the specified storage and task list.
* @param storage The storage component responsible for saving and loading task data.
* @param tasks   The task list containing the user's tasks.
* Parses the user input and returns the corresponding command.
* @param input The user input to be parsed.
* @return The command represented by the user input, or {@code Command.UNKNOWN} if the input is not recognized.
* Executes the core functionality of parsing user input and performing relevant actions.
* This method reads user input, parses it, and executes the appropriate command based on the parsed input.
* It handles various command types and associated error checks, displaying appropriate messages and performing
* actions like marking tasks as done, adding tasks, deleting tasks, and more.
// Error: No argument or Multiple arguments provided
+ "Please only input ONE integer after the word mark!");
// Error: Argument provided is not a number
+ "Please only input INTEGERs after the word mark!");
// Error: Argument provided is not within anya.task numbers
+ "I don't see a task with the number:" + taskNumber);
// Error: Argument provided is already Done (Future implementation)
System.out.println("    Waku waku! I've marked this task as Done:\n" + t);
// Error: No argument or Multiple arguments provided
+ "Please only input ONE integer after the word unmark!");
// Error: Argument provided is not a number
+ "Please only input INTEGERs after the word unmark!");
// Error: Argument provided is not within anya.task numbers
+ "I don't see a task with the number:" + taskNumber);
System.out.println("    Waku waku! I've marked this task as Not Done:\n" + t);
+ "Please input a description after the word todo!");
System.out.println("    Waku waku! I've added this task:\n" + t);
System.out.println("    Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list!");
// Error: No argument or wrong no of arguments provided
throw new InvalidArgumentException("☹ Waku waku! Please input in the following format: "
System.out.println("    Waku waku! I've added this task:\n" + t);
System.out.println("    Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list!");
throw new InvalidArgumentException("☹ Waku waku! Please input in the following format:\n"
throw new InvalidArgumentException("☹ Waku waku! Please input in the following format:\n"

System.out.println("    Waku waku! I've added this task:\n" + t);

throw new InvalidArgumentException("☹ Waku waku! Please input in the following format:\n"
// Error: Argument provided is not a number
+ "Please only input INTEGERs after the word unmark!");
// Error: Argument provided is not within anya.task numbers
+ "I don't see a anya.task with the number:" + taskNumber);
String result = "    Waku waku! I've removed this task:\n" + t;
result += "    Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list!";
String result = "☹ Waku waku!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means (yet) :( ";
* The `Storage` class is responsible for managing the storage of task data in the Anya application.
* It provides functionality to read, write, and convert task data between the application and the storage file.
* Constructs a new `Storage` instance with the specified storage file path.
* @param path The file path where task data is stored.
* @throws InvalidStorageFilePathException If the provided storage file path is invalid (doesn't end with '.txt').
throw new InvalidStorageFilePathException("Storage file should end with '.txt'");
* Returns true if the given path is acceptable as a storage file.
* @param filePath The file path to be checked.
* @return true if the file path ends with '.txt', indicating it's a valid storage file path.
* Loads task data from the storage file and returns it as a `TaskList`.
* @throws StorageOperationException If an error occurs while reading or creating the storage file.
System.out.println("Directory was not found. New directory " + directory.getName() + " is created");
System.out.println("File is not found. New File created: " + source.getName());
System.out.println("File already exists. Your data is loaded");
throw new StorageOperationException("Error writing to file: " + storageFilePath);

* Represents a deadline task in the Anya application.
* A deadline task is a task with a specific due date and time.

* @param description A description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The due date and time of the deadline task.
* Constructs a new `Deadline` instance with the specified description, deadline date-time, and done status.
* @param description A description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The due date and time of the deadline task.
* @param isDone      A boolean indicating whether the task is marked as done.
public Deadline(String description, String by, Boolean isDone) {
* Returns the type of task, which is 'D' for deadline.

* Formats a `LocalDateTime` object as a string in the "MMM d yyyy HH:mm" format.
* @param date The `LocalDateTime` object to be formatted.
* Represents an event task in the Anya application.
* An event task is a task with a specific start date and time and an end date and time.
* Constructs a new `Event` instance with the specified description, start date-time, and end date-time.
* @param description A description of the event task.
* @param from        The start date and time of the event task.
* @param to          The end date and time of the event task.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* A task has a description and a completion status.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done anya.task with X
* Represents a collection of tasks in the Anya application.
* The `TaskList` class provides methods for adding, removing, accessing, and listing tasks.
* Constructs a new `TaskList` with the specified list of tasks.
* @param tasks An ArrayList of tasks to initialize the `TaskList`.
* @param task The task to be added.
* @param task The task to be removed.
* Retrieves a task from the `TaskList` at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to be retrieved.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the `TaskList`.
* Lists all tasks in the `TaskList` with their corresponding indices.
StringBuilder list = new StringBuilder("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Finds and displays tasks containing a specified keyword in their descriptions.
* @param input The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Represents a todo task in the Anya application.
* A todo task is a simple task with a description.
* Constructs a new `Todo` instance with the specified description.
* @param description A description of the todo task.
* Constructs a new `Todo` instance with the specified description and done status.
* @param description A description of the todo task.
* @param isDone      A boolean indicating whether the task is marked as done.
* Returns the type of task, which is 'T' for todo.
* Formats the `Todo` object as a string for saving to storage.
* @return A string representation of the `Todo` object suitable for storage.
* Represents the User Interface (UI) of the Anya application.
* The UI handles interactions with the user, displaying messages, and receiving user input.

* @param out The output stream to display messages to the user.
